title: How to Make a Crepe Cake

steps.headline: Combine the wet ingredients together into a large bowl.
steps.description: Beat the milk, water, eggs and melted butter together until well-combined.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Pour In the flour, sugar, and salt. Mix once more using a whisk to fully incorporate the ingredients and form the crepe batter. Set aside for later use.

steps.headline: Preheat the stovetop to medium heat.
steps.description: Place a medium-sized skillet on top and add half a tablespoon of butter on it. Allow the butter to fully melt.

steps.headline: Using a ladle, scoop three tablespoons of crepe batter onto the pan.
steps.description: Twirl the pan around so the batter can spread out.

steps.headline: Cook the crepe on both sides for about 30 seconds.
steps.description: Flip the crepe using a spatula. Ensure both sides are a light golden brown color.

steps.headline: Continue making crepes until there is no more batter.
steps.description: Set the crepes aside to cool on a wire rack and allow them to cool until they reach room temperature. Once they're cool, stack them on top of each other.

steps.headline: Make the crepe cake frosting.
steps.description: In a medium-sized bowl, blend the butter, cream cheese, condensed milk and vanilla extract with an electric mixer. Mix well until the frosting is well-combined and smooth.

steps.headline: Assemble the crepe cake.
steps.description: Lay one crepe onto a circular cake tray. Using a large butter knife, spread the frosting all around the crepe. Evenly add another crepe on top and spread the frosting once more. Continue by layering the crepes on top of one another and adding frosting to form a crepe cake.

steps.headline: Chill the cake in the fridge.
steps.description: Place the cake on a cake tray and cover it with its lid. Leave it to chill in the fridge for about 6 hours or more until the cake is firm.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Slice the cake and serve onto a serving plate. Garnish with whipped cream, fresh berries, chocolate sauce, sprinkles or powdered sugar. Enjoy!

steps.description: In a medium-sized pot, melt the butter for about 5-7 minutes until it slightly browns. Pour in a bowl and set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Heat up the milk in the same pot.
steps.description: Pour the milk into the pot and allow it to heat up for about 5-6 minutes until it slightly bubbles. Set aside to cool once done.

steps.headline: In a large bowl, mix the dry ingredients and eggs together.
steps.description: Using a whisk, combine the flour, sugar and cocoa powder together. Crack in the eggs and blend with an electric mixer.

steps.headline: Pour the cooled butter and milk into the ingredients.
steps.description: Mix once more with an electric mixer until the crepe batter is formed.

steps.headline: Cook the crepes.

steps.description: Ensure both sides are a light golden brown color. Continue making crepes until there is no more batter.

steps.headline: Set the crepes aside to cool on a wire rack.
steps.description: Allow them to cool until they reach room temperature.

steps.headline: Assemble the crepe cake together.
steps.description: Lay out one crepe onto a circular cake tray. Using a large butter knife, spread the whipped cream all around the crepe. Evenly add another crepe on top and spread the whipped cream once more. Continue by layering the crepes on top of one another and add some whipped cream to form a crepe cake.

steps.headline: Make the ganache.
steps.description: In a medium-sized pot, heat up the sugar and heavy cream until it begins to bubble. Pour it into a bowl and add the butter to the chocolate. Stir until melted and creamy. Set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Spread the ganache all over the crepe cake.
steps.description: Using a large butter knife, spread the ganache all over the top and sides of the cake.

steps.description: Place the cake on a cake tray and cover it with its lid. Leave it to chill in the fridge for about 6 hours or more until the cake is firm.

steps.headline: Serve and enjoy!
steps.description: Slice the cake and serve onto a serving plate. Garnish with whipped cream, fresh berries, sprinkles or powdered sugar. Enjoy!
